lines.text: My dear Mycroft, this is a surprise! Watson, some sherry... Is this a social call?
Yes, yes, oh yes, purely social.
[pause]
How are you?
Very well.
[pause]
Well, now that the social call is over, hadn't we better get down to business?

For Heaven's sake, stop sawing away on that infernal instrument! It was a sad day when Mother gave it to you, a sad day for her, a sad day for you, a sad day for us all... What I cannot understand is why, since you've had that violin with you so long, you never learned to play!
Chunky?
Yes, Annie?
You can have it for nothing if you want to, I'm feeling real lonely tonight, Chunky.
Oh, no thanks, love, I'm too busy, honest.
Oh.
Where did you get this case?
I believe it to have come from a White Chapel pawn shop, sir.
A Pawn shop. No more than I predicted for him...
For whom, sir?
My eldest son, Michael.
Do you know of his present address?
He is dead.
Oh, of what accident or sickness, your grace?
Disobedience. From the day he left this house against my wishes, he has been dead, sir.
You mean disowned, your grace.
Come, Mister Beck, your face reacts faster than your brain. You remember very well...
Someone should have sent for us before this, Holmes.
Someone has. The woman who sent me that instrument case.
Oh, but then why doesn't she come out into the open?
Being a woman, she uses a women's art. She intrigues us to White Chapel.
What's all this about, Holmes, how did you get here?
I followed this young lady.
I saw no one.
That is exactly what you'd expect to see when I follow someone.
But how on Earth did you get out of it, Holmes?
You know my methods, Watson, I am well known to be indestructable.
I do believe this damn whore's lifted my purse.
Nobody steals in my pub, except me!
Would you stand up?
Whatever for?
It is an old maxim of mine that when you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth, and therefore, you are sitting on my pipe.
Holmes, there was an identical murder of a woman in Whitechapel just three days ago.
Aha, a second murder!
Mm.-hmmm
Now, that is interesting.
Why?
Because it is the second murder.
That is mere conjecture, Holmes.
All circumstantial evidence is conjecture, Murray, but it is often right.
Mr. Holmes is usually right.

[to Lord Carfax]
I followed this young lady.
I saw no one.
That is exactly what people may expect to see when I follow them.
